Class ElementsBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.softeng.is25am10.model.boards.ElementsBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlienBoard, AstronautBoard, BatteryBoard, GoodsBoard
public abstract class ElementsBoard extends Object implements Serializable
Used as a superclass by the classes AstronautBoard, AlienBoard, BatteryBoard and GoodsBoard. It provides a framework for those classes which place units above certain tiles. Contains some functions such as constructor, get methods, and some basic management such as removing units or moving units between tiles.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getPositions

      public Map<Coordinate, Integer> getPositions()
      Returns positions, a map storing how many units of a certain type are present in each tile (with defaultValue=0 for each tile)
      Returns:
      positions

    • getTotal

      public int getTotal()
      total stores the total number of units of a certain type that are present on the board
      Returns:
      total

    • get

      public int get(Coordinate c)
      Retrieves the number of units on a certain tile, specified though the coordinates x and y. Uses the method getOrDefault of the Map class.
      Parameters:
      c - coordinate
      Returns:
      number of units on a certain tile

    • set

      protected void set(Coordinate c, int value)
      Sets the number of units on a certain tile, specified though the coordinates x and y to value. It modifies the total number of units based on the previous number of units on that tile.
      Parameters:
      c - coordinate
      value - the new number of units on the tile

    • remove

      public Result<Integer> remove(Coordinate c, int qty)
      Removes units from a certain tile, specified though the coordinates x and y, by the quantity qty. Uses the get and set methods from this class. Checks if there are enough units to be removed on the tile
      Parameters:
      c - coordinate
      qty - the number of units to be removed from the tile.
      Returns:
      a Result containing the number of units remaining on the tile, or an error Result with a message explaining why the operation failed

    • setOthers

      public void setOthers(List<ElementsBoard> other)
      Sets the list of other boards needed for the operation of this board. Not all subclasses use or even need this method, but some do.
      Parameters:
      other - List of other boards that interact with this instance of board.

    • put

      public Result<Integer> put(Coordinate c, int qty)
      Adds a number qty of units to the tile specified though the coordinates x and y. Result.data should not be accessed.
      Parameters:
      c - coordinate
      qty - the number of units to be added to the tile
      Returns:
      a successful Result or an error Result with a message explaining why the operation failed

    • removeIllegals

      public List<Coordinate> removeIllegals()
      Remove all the illegals elements in a board.
      Returns:
      the list f removed elements

    • cantPlace

      public abstract boolean cantPlace(Coordinate c, int qty)
      Check if a quantity is placeable in a specified coordinate. This depends on the specified pawn. The check is implemented in subclasses.
      Parameters:
      c - coordinate
      qty - quantity
      Returns:
      true if the element is placeable here, false if not
